column4: Gents, I upgraded from 11.10 to 12.04, and my Quad NIC cards don't work on the new version. From the drop down menu, I see 'Device Not Ready' message. Can anybody help why I'm receiving this message?
did you try manual configuration instead of network manager?
I switched to Linux about two months ago. I know how to get things working, but not too sure what you mean. Could you please clarify?
'ip' command is the current way to do it. save into /etc/network/interfaces for next boot.
I will try that and get back to you.
maybe network manager, which is in task bar, has problems. you can remove it in software center. then you need to configuer manually
Possibly! But when I plug a network cable into the port, the OS doesn't identify it.
you mean nm at the top doesn't see it?
try it manually, maybe you don't even have to remove nm for a try, just don't use it. 'ip link' for instance should see all interfaces.
'ip addr add 10.0.0.1/24 dev eth0' adds an adress,
I will try that command to add the IP address setting manually via CLI.
I'm back on 11.10 now, and I asked the question many times over the Ubuntu forum but no one bothered to reply :) Cheers krababbel
also don't forget 'ip route' 'ip route add ...' and dns config then. for the next boot, you need interfaces file in /etc/network/ :)
Yep thanks. I will study the 'ip' command and all the options it offers (DNS, Gateway, Subnet mask, etc)
also dns entry is needed now in /etc/resolvconf/base, resolvconf package manages dns now
though in interfaces file there is a line for dns too, forgot that
